pull.title: wallet: refactor: dedup sqlite statement preparations/deletions
pull.body: This refactoring PR deduplicates repeated SQLite statement preparation calls (`sqlite3_prepare_v2(...)`) / deletions (`sqlite3_finalize(...)`) and its surrounding logic by putting each prepared statement and its corresponding text representation into a ~std::map~ ~`std::array`~ `std::vector`. This should be more readable and less error-prone, e.g. in case an additional statement needs to be added in the  future or the error handling has to be adapted.

events.body:
Concept ACK - the resulting code is significantly more readable IMO and this makes the consistent treatment obvious and enforced.

Logically, the underlying values in `statements` are not associated as in a map (i.e. the indexing linking the values is not relevant - one is not logically a key and the other a value). A `std::array<std::tuple>` would seem to be more logically consistent.

Thanks for reviewing!

> Logically, the underlying values in `statements` are not associated as in a map (i.e. the indexing linking the values is not relevant - one is not logically a key and the other a value). A `std::array<std::tuple>` would seem to be more logically consistent.

Agreed, using std::map here is like using a sledgehammer to crack a nut ðŸ˜„ I changed the code to use `std::array<std::pair<...,...>, N>` now -- fortunately the loop code doesn't need to be changed at all. The only drawback is that we need to specify the size N of the array as second template parameter ([`std::make_array`](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/experimental/make_array) would help here, but that is not in the standard yet as far as I know), but I think we can live with that.
reACK 0df8012. The only change is replacing map with array
Any reason to change this method, but not the `Close` method?

rename.from: wallet: refactor: dedup sqlite statement preparations
rename.to: wallet: refactor: dedup sqlite statement preparations/deletions

events.body: Took in the suggestions by MarcoFalke (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21540#pullrequestreview-626939176): applied `clang-format`, changed table type from `std::array` to `std::vector` to avoid typing the size and add another commit to also deduplicate the deletion of statements (`sqlite3_finalize(...)`). Thanks for reviewing!
It was while testing this I noticed #21628. However the issue is also present in master.

comments.body:
```suggestion
        { &m_cursor_stmt,    "SELECT key, value FROM main" },
```

also could `clang-format`

```suggestion
    const std::vector<std::pair<sqlite3_stmt**, const char*>> statements {{
```

You can use vector to avoid having to type the size
